alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 3:22PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas near the West Branch of the Penobscot River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 PM EST, an upstream floodgate release Ripogenus Dam is expected to cause minor flooding near the Abol Bridge Campground and along the Appalachian Trail north of Abol Bridge. - Backwater flooding is also possible on the following streams... Foss and Knowlton Brook, Nesowadnehunk Stream, Chesuncook Stream and Trail Brook. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ripogenus and Baxter State Park. - Discharge at the Ripogenus Dam is approximately 9973 cfs. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
